question.body: Which of the following is not a function of red blood cells?

multiple_choice.choice: Transport oxygen to the cells of the body.
Transport waste products produced by cellular respiration to the lungs.
Transport gas required for aerobic cellular respiration to the cells.
Transports the majority of carbon dioxide to the lungs.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The main function of RBCs is to carry oxygen to the cells of the body.
Incorrect. The RBCs carry about 25% of carbon dioxide waste to the lungs.
Incorrect. Oxygen is required for aerobic cellular respiration and oxygen is carried by RBCs.
Correct. The RBCs only carry 25% of the carbon dioxide to the lungs.
